formattedAddress: 94 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 94 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009-6265, USA

editorialSummary.text: Round-the-clock convenience store & deli preparing sandwiches with classic & creative combos.

originalText.text: A gem in LES! Amazing sandwich selection and everything is delicious. I loved the “Pho 4” sandwich and their chicken soup was just what I needed when I had a cold. Prices are very reasonable and the staff is very kind and friendly.

text.text: A gem in LES! Amazing sandwich selection and everything is delicious. I loved the “Pho 4” sandwich and their chicken soup was just what I needed when I had a cold. Prices are very reasonable and the staff is very kind and friendly.

originalText.text: This place is quite good if you get the right stuff. Not the best chicken cutlets, but everything else I’ve gotten has been top tier. This picture is their 101 that’s like a Reuben with boars head turkey and bacon on it

text.text: This place is quite good if you get the right stuff. Not the best chicken cutlets, but everything else I’ve gotten has been top tier. This picture is their 101 that’s like a Reuben with boars head turkey and bacon on it

originalText.text: All I can say is delicious!! Loved the Italian and Godfather. They have a huge selection of subs and fresh soup every day. I had the chicken noodle and it was fantastic. Hope to be back soon!

text.text: All I can say is delicious!! Loved the Italian and Godfather. They have a huge selection of subs and fresh soup every day. I had the chicken noodle and it was fantastic. Hope to be back soon!

originalText.text:
If you're looking for a bodega with fantastic sandwiches, look no further than this spot.

My husband and I shared a Pho 10 Sandwich with Bulgogi. The sandwich was huge so you can easily split one. I loved everything about it. It had a bit of a kick too. I recommend taking your sandwich over to the garden across the street to eat.

There were plenty of other sandwiches on the menu I wanted to try so I'd gladly come back.

text.text:
If you're looking for a bodega with fantastic sandwiches, look no further than this spot.

My husband and I shared a Pho 10 Sandwich with Bulgogi. The sandwich was huge so you can easily split one. I loved everything about it. It had a bit of a kick too. I recommend taking your sandwich over to the garden across the street to eat.

There were plenty of other sandwiches on the menu I wanted to try so I'd gladly come back.

originalText.text:
Sunny and Annie's is very much a 24/7 neighborhood gem--come for the everyday corner shop convenience...but stay for the sandwiches (and order one!). this small family-owned store has been serving residents and visitors to the EV for years. the corner store is packed with a deli counter, snacks and candy, some grocery items, household goods and more.

there are so many sandwiches on the handwritten menu. there is literally something for everyone from hot sandwiches, cold sandwiches, wraps, and more. some sandwiches are named celebrities, politicians, etc. i have had a number of different sandwiches and have barely made a dent in the list. never had a bad sando experience here. my go-to basic sandwich is the tuna salad hero which is packed with protein/tuna, fresh lettuce and tomatoes--all cradled in quality hero roll. tastes great, always filling,  and never fishy. tuna hero is $9 + tip

the owners + deli guys are super nice. treat them well.
